item.title: RSA
item.description: If we can find 3 integers e,d and n such that for all m âˆˆ [0,n), m^e^d % n = m holds, (i.e. one can pick any m, and get the same m back by raising m^e^d - all under modulo n arithmetic system) then according to the discrete log hardness assumption (DLHA), it should be computationally infeasible to recover m by knowing only m^e, e and n. recover d by knowing only e, n and m.
